intro: Kingiella hebe, commonly known as the mountain hebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces showy blue or purple flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Kingiella hebe is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and its ability to attract pollinators.
